update.description:
Disable clouds when a render texture is created.

Another change is that the workaround in gpu laser is moved into SkyX, where the moon manager is now disabled as it affects gpu range values. 

Update:

- Also fixed camera deletion caused by gzclient's camera visual not being deleted properly.
update.title: Disable clouds in offscreen rendering

content.raw:
Before merging, do you mind fixing a style error in parser_urdf.cc:649?

http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-precise-amd64/346/cppcheckResult/
content.html:
Before merging, do you mind fixing a style error in parser_urdf.cc:649?

update.description:
Disable clouds when a render texture is created.

Another change is that the workaround in gpu laser is moved into SkyX, where the moon manager is now disabled as it affects gpu range values. 

Update:

- Also fixed camera deletion caused by gzclient's camera visual not being deleted properly.
update.title: Disable clouds in offscreen rendering

content.raw:
I just tried it out and the clouds do not appear in rviz and Gazebo's topic visualization window.

Here is a [screenshot](https://www.dropbox.com/s/61snmjl97pho2l6/disable_clouds.png) of the atlas camera view in qual 1.
content.html:
I just tried it out and the clouds do not appear in rviz and Gazebo's topic visualization window.

Here is a screenshot of the atlas camera view in qual 1.

content.raw:
I tested qual 1, and the atlas camera view through rviz still shows clouds, is that expected?

Newly spawned cameras do not have clouds in them.
content.html:
I tested qual 1, and the atlas camera view through rviz still shows clouds, is that expected?

Newly spawned cameras do not have clouds in them.
Should resolve issue #652.

content.raw:
I can confirm the same effect described by @scpeters

Jenkins information: no new failing tests for [this branch](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-vrc/29/consoleFull) compared to [current default](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-nvidia/185/#showFailuresLink).
content.html:
I can confirm the same effect described by @scpeters

Jenkins information: no new failing tests for this branch compared to current default.

content.raw:
In my testing, inserting a camera caused the sky to disappear in gzclient. Deleting the camera causes seg-fault:
~~~
Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
Ogre::Camera::getDerivedPosition (this=0x0)
    at /build/buildd/ogre-1.7.4/OgreMain/src/OgreCamera.cpp:504
504	/build/buildd/ogre-1.7.4/OgreMain/src/OgreCamera.cpp: No such file or directory.
(gdb) bt
#0  Ogre::Camera::getDerivedPosition (this=0x0)
    at /build/buildd/ogre-1.7.4/OgreMain/src/OgreCamera.cpp:504
#1  0x00007ffff19b6bbc in SkyX::SkyX::notifyCameraRender(Ogre::Camera*) ()
   from /home/scpeters/local/lib/libgazebo_skyx.so.1
#2  0x00007ffff104d5d0 in Ogre::RenderTarget::fireViewportPreUpdate (
    this=<optimized out>, vp=<optimized out>)
    at /build/buildd/ogre-1.7.4/OgreMain/src/OgreRenderTarget.cpp:419
#3  0x00007ffff104d9f0 in Ogre::RenderTarget::_updateViewport (
    this=0x7fffa808d4a0, viewport=0x7fffb7504b88, updateStatistics=true)
    at /build/buildd/ogre-1.7.4/OgreMain/src/OgreRenderTarget.cpp:145

update.description:
Disable clouds when a render texture is created.

Another change is that the workaround in gpu laser is moved into SkyX, where the moon manager is now disabled as it affects gpu range values.
update.title: Disable clouds in offscreen rendering
